question: Ionic compounds have strong electrostatic attractions between oppositely charged ions in this?

nodes.text: Ionic compounds have strong electrostatic attractions between oppositely charged ions in an incorrect array.
Normal arrays exhibit strong electrostatic attractions between oppositely charged ions in ionic compounds.
Ionic compounds have strong electrostatic attractions between oppositely charged ions in an occasional array.
Ionic compounds have strong electrostatic attractions between oppositely charged ions in a regular array.
